intro: Vincetoxicum coskuncelebianus, commonly known as the Coskun's false bindweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It is characterized by its woody stems and milky sap, typical of the family. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided in horticulture but can be found in wild areas.
